content.title: Farm Machinery Bank (FMB)/Farm Machinery Hub (FMH)
content.department: Department Of Agriculture, Government of West Bengal
content.beneficiary: Rural Youth Entrepreneurs and Groups approved by Government Institutions
content.details: Farm Machinery Bank (FMB)/Farm Machinery Hub (FMH) under the Farm Mechanization Umbrella Scheme was introduced in the year 2023 for setting up Farm Machinery Bank(FMB) and will also be continued in 2024-25. The objective is to create employment opportunities among the rural youth/entrepreneurs for setting up of the Hub with special emphasis on the areas having low farm power availability.
benefits: 80% subsidy on Total Financial Outlay (TFO) subject to maximum Rs 8.00 lakh
Facilitates end-to-end use of farm machinery for small and marginal farmers
Promotes self-employment for rural youth and entrepreneurs
Supports primary processing units like dal mill, oil mill, etc.
eligibility: Individual Rural Youth Entrepreneur registered under Krishak Bandhu (New) Scheme
Groups like SKUS/PACS/FPO/FPC/FIG/SHG approved by any Govt Institution
Sufficient land under possession for setting up FMB/FMH
Minimum age of 18 years at the time of application
exclusions: Individuals or their spouses who have availed benefits under FSSM/OTA-SFI/FMB/CHC
Employees/retired employees of State Government, Statutory Bodies, Government Undertakings, etc.
documents_required: Title Deed/ROR/Lease Certificate/Rent Receipt of land
Detailed project report for AIF (if applicable)
Vetted plan & estimate for shade of FMB/FMH
Resolution of the organization regarding authorization of signatory

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To facilitate end-to-end use of farm machinery for small and marginal farmers at reasonable charges.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department Of Agriculture, Government of West Bengal.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Individual Rural Youth Entrepreneur registered under Krishak Bandhu (New) Scheme or approved groups.

faqs.question: How to avail the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers can apply online in Matirkatha/FMS portal after due advertisement.

faqs.question: What is the process for availing the subsidy?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries will purchase approved equipment through self-finance/Bank Loan and submit subsidy claims.

faqs.question: Is there any fee or charges for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no charges to apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any age restriction?
faqs.answer: The age of the beneficiary should be minimum 18 years at the time of application.

faqs.question: How will the subsidy be released to the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Payment of subsidy will be made by the DDA(Admn) to the beneficiary's Bank Account in DBT mode.
